meanings.definition: excessively concerned with minor details or rules
meanings.sent1: She is overparticular about the color of her pens, always making sure they match her notebooks.
meanings.sent2: The teacher was overparticular about the students' handwriting, insisting on perfect cursive.
meanings.sent3: His overparticular nature when it comes to organizing his desk sometimes makes his friends laugh.
meanings.sent4: The chef's overparticular attention to the seasoning of the dish elevated it to a culinary masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: The overparticular gardener meticulously trimmed each leaf on the plant, creating a work of art in the garden.

meanings.sent1: The overparticular cat refused to eat any food that wasn't served in its favorite bowl.
meanings.sent2: She was overparticular about the way her clothes were folded, rearranging them until they were just right.
meanings.sent3: His overparticular taste in music meant he would only listen to songs from a specific era.
meanings.sent4: The overparticular editor meticulously checked every comma and period in the manuscript.
meanings.sent5: The overparticular customer returned the shirt because it had a tiny imperfection in the stitching.
